articles.title: What it's like to have aphasia, the 'devastating' language disorder Bruce Willis has - CBC.ca
articles.description: There are over 100,000 Canadians living with aphasia, a communication disorder that affects the ability to understand and express language, according to the Aphasia Institute. Christine Patten is one of them.
articles.content:
Before what she and her husband call their "one bad day," Christine Patten was a director at a global law firm and an expert communicator.
Now, Patten, 54, struggles to describe what happened after … [+7551 chars]
